remarks: doi:10.1600/036364412X616602 Etymology: Blechnum areolatum is named for the presence of areoles contiguous to the costae, a rare character in Blechnum.

reference: Festschrift Albert von Bamberg 59. 1905 Einige neue Farne aus Sudbrasilien
distribution: Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil, Southern America)

remarks: Etymology: Blechnum longipilosum is named for the presence of long, 4- (5–10) 11–12-celled hairs on rachises, costae, veins, laminar tissue, and indusia, and between sporangia. doi:10.1600/036364412X616602

reference: Arq. Inst. Biol. Veg. 2(1): 2, pl.1, f.3; pl. 3. 1935 [Sep 1935]

distribution: Mato Grosso (Brazil West-Central, Brazil, Southern America)
remarks: doi:10.1590/1677-941X-ABB-2022-0147 Etymology: the specific epithet is from the Latin 'rivulorum' = of the rivers, indicating the preferred habitat of the species.
